title: 111_hr315
content: The Act titled "Federal Customer Service Enhancement Act" establishes performance measures and standards for customer service provided by federal agencies. The Federal Customer Service Enhancement Act requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to develop performance measures and standards for federal agencies to provide high-quality customer service. Federal agencies must collect customer feedback through surveys or focus groups to assess service quality. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will issue an annual report on Federal agencies' success in meeting customer service performance measures. SEC. 3. IMPLEMENTATION OF CUSTOMER SERVICE STANDARDS. The head of each Federal agency must appoint a customer relations representative responsible for implementing customer service standards and agency requirements. This includes issuing guidelines and contact information to ensure effective customer service within the agency. Each Federal agency must publish customer service contact information on their public website, including a mailing address, telephone number, and email address. Additionally, agencies must include their address and phone number on all stationery, with regional or local office information if applicable. SEC. 4. REPORT BY GOVERNMENT ACCOUNTABILITY OFFICE. The Comptroller General must submit a report to Congress analyzing agencies' implementation of customer service standards, quality improvement, and recommendations for performance measures. The report can be used by Congress and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to update customer service performance measures. SEC. 5. Incentives for customer service include an awards program for employees showing excellence in customer service. Compliance with customer service standards may be part of performance appraisals. SEC. 6 provides definitions. SEC. 6 defines key terms in the Act, including "customer" and "Federal agency." The term "customer" refers to individuals or entities receiving services from a Federal agency. The term "Federal agency" excludes certain agencies for national security reasons.
